node.contents: I'm trying to add a composite component to my JSF Facelets application.

astNode.text: I'm trying to add a composite component to my JSF Facelets application.

node.contents: The composite component (email.xhtml) is as follows:

astNode.text: The composite component (email.xhtml) is as follows:

elements.contents: <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"> <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:composite="http://java.sun.com/jsf/composite" xmlns:h="http://java.sun.com/jsf/html"> <h:head> <title>This content will not be displayed</title> </h:head> <h:body> <composite:interface> <composite:attribute name="value" required="false" /> </composite:interface> <composite:implementation> <h:outputLabel value="Email id: "></h:outputLabel> <h:inputText value="#{cc.attrs.value}"></h:inputText> </composite:implementation> </h:body> </html>
This content will not be displayed

node.contents: DEPLOY directory structure:

astNode.text: DEPLOY directory structure:

node.contents:
• project
    • HTML files
    • resources/ (including emcomp/ folder)
    • META-INF/
    • WEB-INF/ (config files and lib/ folder)

• project
    • HTML files
    • resources/ (including emcomp/ folder)
    • META-INF/
    • WEB-INF/ (config files and lib/ folder)

node.contents: I have the same problem but have no trailing slash :(

astNode.text: I have the same problem but have no trailing slash :(

node.contents: Remove the trailing slash from the XML namespace URI.

astNode.text: Remove the trailing slash from the XML namespace URI.
